How is Wool Made? | The Wool Journal
www.wool.com/how-is-wool-made
Wool is a natural fiber derived from the fleece of sheep and goats. The process begins with shearing, followed by cleaning, carding, and finally spinning into yarn. The yarn is then woven or knitted into fabrics used for clothing, blankets, and industrial applications.
